poem:
"Rain's Omnipresence"

Atmospheric rivers surge,
California is under siege,
unprecedented, unhinged rage of nature.
Northern hurrying, a new threat foretold.
Southern caution, a warned flash unfolds.
Water seeking its own level: widespread, wild;
In every quiet cup holds a tempest self-styled.
A storm of storms, no shelter from the rain;
Into every crack and crevice, will water's will, will reign.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The National Weather Service issued its first ever warning of hurricane force winds for the San Francisco area in northern California while, further south, the federal service gave a rare “high risk” of flash flooding warning for Los Angeles.
